                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                        <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                            <gmd:organisationName>
                                <gco:CharacterString>Ganaraska Region Conservation Authority (GRCA)</gco:CharacterString>
                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"

                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Surface water quality has been monitored intensively across the GRCA since 2002; however, some water quality stations have been monitored since the 1960s and 1970s through the Provincial Water Quality Monitoring Network (PWQMN). Over the past decade, the following programs have been implemented by the GRCA either independently or in partnership with other agencies: (A) PWQMN – evaluation and trending background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems. (B) High Water Event Monitoring – evaluation of surface water quality related to high flows caused by rainfall or snowmelt. (C) Ganaraska Region Water Quality Monitoring Network - evaluation and trending background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems throughout a watershed. (D) Baseflow Water Quality Monitoring - evaluation of background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems during baseflow conditions. (E) Chloride Monitoring - Evaluation and trending background chloride concentrations to understand general location and concentrations of chloride through the GRCA.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

            </gmd:topicCategory>

                                <gco:Boolean>1</gco:Boolean>

                                    <gml:beginPosition>2020-01-20T00:00:00+00:00</gml:beginPosition>
                                    <gml:endPosition>2022-04-20T00:00:00+00:00</gml:endPosition>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-xy6w-vg58
notes: Surface water quality has been monitored intensively across the GRCA since 2002; however, some water quality stations have been monitored since the 1960s and 1970s through the Provincial Water Quality Monitoring Network (PWQMN). Over the past decade, the following programs have been implemented by the GRCA either independently or in partnership with other agencies: (A) PWQMN – evaluation and trending background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems. (B) High Water Event Monitoring – evaluation of surface water quality related to high flows caused by rainfall or snowmelt. (C) Ganaraska Region Water Quality Monitoring Network - evaluation and trending background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems throughout a watershed. (D) Baseflow Water Quality Monitoring - evaluation of background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems during baseflow conditions. (E) Chloride Monitoring - Evaluation and trending background chloride concentrations to understand general location and concentrations of chloride through the GRCA.

notes_translated.en: Surface water quality has been monitored intensively across the GRCA since 2002; however, some water quality stations have been monitored since the 1960s and 1970s through the Provincial Water Quality Monitoring Network (PWQMN). Over the past decade, the following programs have been implemented by the GRCA either independently or in partnership with other agencies: (A) PWQMN – evaluation and trending background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems. (B) High Water Event Monitoring – evaluation of surface water quality related to high flows caused by rainfall or snowmelt. (C) Ganaraska Region Water Quality Monitoring Network - evaluation and trending background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems throughout a watershed. (D) Baseflow Water Quality Monitoring - evaluation of background surface water quality to understand general location and cause of water quality problems during baseflow conditions. (E) Chloride Monitoring - Evaluation and trending background chloride concentrations to understand general location and concentrations of chloride through the GRCA.
notes_translated.fr: La qualité des eaux de surface fait l'objet d'une surveillance intensive dans l'ensemble de la GRCA depuis 2002 ; toutefois, certaines stations de qualité de l'eau sont surveillées depuis les années 1960 et 1970 par le biais du Réseau provincial de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau (PWQMN). Au cours de la dernière décennie, les programmes suivants ont été mis en œuvre par la GRCA de manière indépendante ou en partenariat avec d'autres agences : (A) PWQMN — évaluation et évolution de la qualité de l'eau de surface de base pour comprendre l'emplacement général et la cause des problèmes de qualité de l'eau. (B) Surveillance des crues — évaluation de la qualité des eaux de surface en lien avec les débits élevés causés par les pluies ou la fonte des neiges. (C) Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau de la région de Ganaraska - évaluation et analyse des tendances de la qualité de l'eau de surface de base afin de comprendre l'emplacement général et la cause des problèmes de qualité de l'eau dans un bassin versant. (D) Surveillance de la qualité de l'eau du débit de base - évaluation de la qualité de fond de l'eau de surface pour comprendre l'emplacement général et la cause des problèmes de qualité de l'eau dans les conditions de débit de base. (E) Surveillance du chlorure - Évaluation et évolution des concentrations de fond de chlorure afin de comprendre la localisation générale et les concentrations de chlorure grâce au GRCA.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: GRCA Monthly Water Quality Monitoring

title_translated.fr: Surveillance mensuelle de la qualité de l'eau GRCA

title_translation_method.fr: Title text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate
